title: Input Validation Middleware
description:
Create Custom Express Middleware for Request Payload Validation and Sanitization

Implement reusable middleware that validates and sanitizes incoming HTTP request payloads using Yup schema definitions, providing consistent validation across API endpoints.

Requirements:
- Create a middleware factory function that accepts Yup schemas as configuration
- Support validation for request body, query parameters, and URL parameters
- Sanitize input data by stripping unknown fields and applying type coercion
- Return standardized error responses (400 Bad Request) with clear validation messages
- Include field-specific error details to help clients identify issues
- Handle async validation if schemas include async rules
- Support optional vs required field validation
- Allow configuration of validation options (abortEarly, stripUnknown, etc.)
- Add TypeScript types if applicable for better developer experience
- Create example usage with common schemas (user registration, login, etc.)

Edge Cases to Consider:
- Malformed JSON payloads
- Missing required fields
- Type mismatches (string when number expected)
- Nested object validation
- Array validation with min/max constraints
- Custom validation rules beyond Yup's built-in validators

Dependencies:
- Yup library installed and configured
- Express.js application structure
- Error handling middleware to catch validation failures
